definition: stumbling block/obstacle/someone who gets in your way
to trip/to stumble/to hinder
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Shi

sentences.english: In his letter of resignation, the General admitted that he has become a liability to the president.
sentences.chinese: 在辭職信中，將軍承認他已經成爲總統的絆腳石。

sentences.english: The stumbling block lies with their conflicting views of space and time.
sentences.chinese: 絆腳石正是它們對空間和時間觀念的衝突。

sentences.english: Diapers seem to be a stumbling block for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 尿片似乎對所有人來說都是個絆腳石。

sentences.english: Please don't move that stumbling block, but lead me , Lord, around it.
sentences.chinese: 上帝，請不要搬開那塊絆腳石，指引我繞開它。

sentences.english: I know this is my biggest stumbling block.
sentences.chinese: 我知道這是我最大的絆腳石。

sentences.english: The next rock in your path may be a stepping stone.
sentences.chinese: 也許人生路上的下一個絆腳石就是墊腳石。

sentences.english: Overstaffing has become the obstacle for reforms.
sentences.chinese: 人浮於事已成爲改革的絆腳石。

sentences.english: But it can also be destructive, and become an obstacle to success.
sentences.chinese: 但競爭也具有破壞性，成爲阻礙成功的絆腳石。

sentences.english: Wilfulness is the stumbling block in a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 任性，刁蠻是婚姻的絆腳石。

sentences.english: Agriculture continues to be the main stumbling block to a deal.
sentences.chinese: 農業仍舊是達成協議最大的絆腳石。

sentences.english: Second-guessing is what gets in the way of a writer’s ability to write faster.
sentences.chinese: “推敲”是阻礙作者寫得更快的絆腳石。

sentences.english: Articles and prepositions are stumbling blocks to the beginners of English.
sentences.chinese: 冠詞和介係詞對英文初學者來說是個絆腳石。

sentences.english: The key to success is to turn blocking stone into stepping-stone.
sentences.chinese: 人生的一大祕訣就是將絆腳石變成墊腳石。

sentences.english: Our CM tool was a stumbling block in this project.
sentences.chinese: 我們的配置管理工具是我們這個項目的一塊絆腳石。

sentences.english: Pride is a stumbling block to real progress.
sentences.chinese: 驕傲自滿是真正取得進步的絆腳石。

sentences.english: Rules trip up both individuals and teams causing unintended consequences.
sentences.chinese: 規則是個人和團隊的絆腳石，導致不可預知的後果。

definition: to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
to run in the opposite direction (idiom); to run counter to
(abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
to leave the rails/to derail/to jump the track
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
form of government
bureaucracy
to depart from/to deviate from/deviation
stake/vital interest/concern
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
academic freedom
initiative/active role
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
to discharge one's duties/conscientious
